intro: Psychotria ankafinensis, commonly known as the Madagascar Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically consumed by local wildlife. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
